msItem.note: List of contents, probably in the hand of Sir John Prise, s. xvi
msItem.quote:
Gregorij Nazanzeni Apologeticus
Eiusdem vij sermones
Expositio Baptisterij
Ambrosius de obseruantia episcoporum
Augustinus contra v hereses.
Didimus de spiritu sancto.
Duodecim abusiua
msItem.note: Another hand also entered this list on the cover.
List of contents, in the main hand
msItem.incipit: Hęc sunt quę continentur in hoc libro. Apologeticus Gregorii Nazanzeni. et .vii. sermones eiusdem. Expositio baptisterii. Ambrosius de obseruantia episcoporum. Augustinus contra .v. hereses. Didimus de spiritu sancto. Duodecim abusiua.

msItem.author: Rufinus
msItem.title: Praefatio ad Apronianum in libris Gregorii Nanzanzeni
msItem.rubric: fol. 2r Pręfatio rufini presbiteri de libris Gregorii.

msItem.title: Apologeticus (or. 1)
msItem.incipit: Victus sum⸵ et fateor me esse. superatum.
msItem.explicit: fol. 28r cui gloria in saecula saeculorum amen.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit apologeticus sancti Gregorii nazanzenii episcopi.

msItem.title: De epiphaniis siue De natiuitate Christi (or. 2)
msItem.rubric: fol. 28r Incipit liber eiusdem de epiphaniis siue de natali domini.
msItem.explicit: fol. 35r in quantum iunctis in carne possibile est⸵ per ipsum iesum christum dominum nostrum. cui est gloria et potestas in saecula saeculorum amen.

msItem.title: De luminibus siue secundis epiphaniis (or. 3)
msItem.rubric: fol. 35r Incipit .ii. de luminibus quod est secundis epiphaniis.
msItem.incipit: Iterum iesus meus⸵ et iterum misterium.
msItem.explicit: fol. 43v uestra fulgeat coram hominibus. per christum dominum nostrum cui est gloria in saecula saeculorum amen.

msItem.title: De pentecoste et spritu sancto (or. 4)
msItem.incipit: De sollempnitate huius diei pauca dicenda sunt⸵ ut lętamur in spiritu.
msItem.explicit: fol. 56v qui est uera et niua festiuitas et exultatio sanctorum. cum quo est deo patri gloria et potestas in spiritu sancto⸵ in saecula saeculorum amen.

msItem.title: De semetipso de agro reuerso (or. 5)
msItem.rubric: fol. 50v Incipit quartus insemetipso de agro regressus.
msItem.explicit: fol. 57v uita et fide probabili⸵ tibi gloria et potestas in saecula saeculorum amen.

msItem.title: De dictis Ieremiae (or. 6)
msItem.rubric: fol. 57v Incipit .v. De ieremia dicta praesente imperatore apud quem et intercedit pro quodam periclitante.
msItem.explicit: fol. 62v et infuturo misericordiam speramus. per christum dominum nostrum uiuentem secum et regnantem cum spiritu sancto in saecula saeculorum amen.

msItem.title: De reconciliatione et unitate monachorum (or. 7)
msItem.rubric: fol. 62v Incipit .vi. de reconciliatione et unitate monachorum.
msItem.explicit: fol. 71r custodiat corda uestra in christo iesu domino nostro⸵ cui est gloria et potestas in saecula saeculorum amen.

msItem.title: De uastatione grandinis (or. 8)
msItem.rubric: fol. 71r Incipit .vii. de grandinis uastatione cum pater episcopus reticeret.
msItem.explicit: fol. 78v cui est gloria et potestas in saecula saeculorum Amen.

msItem.author: Leidrad
msItem.title: De sacramento baptismi
msItem.rubric: fol. 78v Incipit explanatio baptisterii. entered in new hand, blue ink
msItem.explicit: fol. 91r rex regum et dominus dominantium.

msItem.author: Didymus Caecus of Alexandria
msItem.title: De spiritu sancto
msItem.rubric: fol. 91r Incipit liber didimi de spiritu sancto.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber didimi de spiritu sancto.

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De XII abusiuis saeculi
msItem.rubric: fol. 120v Incipit epistola sancti cipriani martiris. de duodecim abusiuis.

msItem.author: Ambrose
msItem.title: Libellus de dignitate sacerdotali
msItem.rubric: fol. 130r Ambrosii mediolanensis episcopi liber de obseruantia episcoporum incipit.
msItem.explicit: fol. 135r te sanctis dare promisisti. Amen.

msItem.author: Jerome
msItem.title: Praefatio in libro Didymi Alexandrini De spiritu sancto
msItem.rubric: fol. 135r Incipit prefatio sancti ieronimi presbiteri in didimum de spiritu sancto. ad paulinianum. with guide in margin above, trimmed

supportDesc.foliation: Foliation in modern pencil from 1 to 136 in the upper right corner, beginning on the final upper endleaf.
supportDesc.collation: a4 (1,2 pastedowns) + 1–108 1112 12–148 1512 || 168 (8 pastedown) While gathering 16 is an addition, it was probably made to be appended here, as suggested by its equal layout and last text, Jerome’s preface to Didymus’s De spiritu sancto, absent from the text on fols. 91r–120v. Gatherings 1–14 numbered i to xiiii in ink at base of first folio of each gathering, also added to the last by another hand in most cases. dauid aperiat

layoutDesc.layout:
fols. 2r–127v:
33 long lines. No prickings visible, ruled in drypoint.
fols. 130r–136v (gathering 16): Single prick to align outer margin.

handDesc.handNote: Hand A: fols. 2r–127v, a medium-quality English protogothic hand of s. xii2/4. This hand also executed the rubrics, bar the incipit in blue ink on fol. 78v, which is by a near-contemporary.
Hand B: fols. 130r–136v or gathering 16, a medium-quality English protogothic hand of s. xii2/3; the rubrics on fols. 130r and 135v are in this or a new hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Fol. 2r: a green arabesque initial P, decorated in red and blue. The subsequent texts in the original unit (up to fol. 129) open with arabesque initials, with lesser or no decoration in one or two colours (red, blue, green).
Fol. 135v: a red initial C, with a bearded face inside the lobe.

additions.p: Titles on the cover in a s. xvii hand (possibly appearing in Jesus College 2 as well): Gregori Nazien Opera; fol. iiv: a list contents in a hand that resembles that of Sir John Prise; an identical book appears in Nomina Librorum Manuscriptorum ex Donatione Iohannis Prise Equitis Aurati Herefordiensis.
Occasional line drawings and corrections in various hands, s. xii/xiii.

Pressmarks: spine, 91 (s. xv?); I Arch. I–3 (ink on paper, s. xvii); MS. Jesus Coll. E. 3 (printed on paper, s. xix?; fol. ir: 2031 = 12 (originally 12, s. xv?; the previous added in s. xv?); 1 Arch. 1–3 (s. xv?); fol. 1r: numb 12 (s. xv?).

binding.p: Romanesque. Whittawed skin over oak boards. Extra cord sewn into binding as a bookmark (between fols. 78 and 79). Single-station sewing, an English technique known from only a few manuscripts. Christopher Clarkson, ‘A Hitherto Unrecorded English Romanesque Book Sewing Technique’, in Roger Powell, the Compleat Binder: Liber Amicorum, ed. John L. Sharpe, Bibliologia 14 (Turnhout: Brepols, 1996), 215–39. J.A. Szirmai, The Archaeology of Medieval Bookbinding (Aldershot, Hampshire: Ashgate, 1999), 148–149.

history.origin: The book is from Leicestershire Abbey (OSA), s. xii2/4 (possibly after 1131). The rubrics for the works of Gregory match London, British Library, Royal MS 3 D. i, and a Gloucestershire form of punctuation is used in the final gathering. Neil R. Ker, English Manuscripts in the Century after the Norman Conquest, The Lyell Lectures 1952–53 (Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1960), p. 48 and pl. 20b.
history.provenance: Recorded in the Registrum Anglie de libris doctorum et auctorum ueterum (R3.1; R18.2, 13, 14) in the fourteenth century.

Owned by John Prise (1501/2–55), with title written on the cover in his hand. A similar note occurs in thirteen other manuscripts at Jesus College, ten of them from Cirencester, and three of unknown provenance.
history.acquisition: Appears in the list of the books of John Prise in the 1602 donation willed to Jesus College by his son Gregory Prise (1535–1600). Neil R. Ker, ‘Sir John Prise’, The Library, 5th ser., 10, no. 1 (March 1955): 1–24, doi:10.1093/library/s5-X.1.1.
